net.dean.jraw.pagination

Class Paginator<T extends Thing>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dean.jraw.pagination.Paginator<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type that the listings will contain
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<Listing<T>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenericPaginator, SpecificPaginator, SubredditPaginator

    public abstract class Paginator<T extends Thing>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Iterator<Listing<T>>
    Represents the basic concept of a paginator

    • Constructor Detail

      • Paginator

        public Paginator(RedditClient creator,
                 java.lang.Class<T> thingType)
        Instantiates a new Paginator
        Parameters:
        creator - The RedditClient that will be used to send HTTP requests
        thingType - The type of Thing that this Paginator will return

    • Method Detail

      • getListing

        protected Listing<T> getListing(boolean forwards)
                         throws NetworkException,
                                java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Gets a listing of things
        Parameters:
        forwards - If true, this method will return the next listing. If false, it will return the first listing.
        Returns:
        A new listing
        Throws:
        NetworkException - If there was a problem sending the HTTP request
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If a setter method (such as setLimit(int) was called after the first listing was requested.

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface java.util.Iterator<Listing<T extends Thing>>

      • next

        public Listing<T> next()
        Gets the next listing.
        Specified by:
        next in interface java.util.Iterator<Listing<T extends Thing>>
        Returns:
        The next listing of submissions
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If there was a problem getting the next listing

      • getBaseUri

        protected abstract java.lang.String getBaseUri()
        Generates the base URI. Parameters will be stacked after this URI to form a query. For example, SimplePaginator will return something like "/r/pics/new.json"
        Returns:
        The base URI that will be used in queries

      • getSorting

        public Sorting getSorting()
        How the Reddit API will choose to return the listing. If the sorting is $Sorting.TOP, then the time period will default to the last requested time period. If there was none, Reddit will use DAY.
        Returns:
        The current sorting

      • getTimePeriod

        public TimePeriod getTimePeriod()
        The time period to get the submissions from
        Returns:
        The time period

      • setSorting

        public void setSorting(Sorting sorting)
        Sets the new sorting
        Parameters:
        sorting - The new sorting

      • setTimePeriod

        public void setTimePeriod(TimePeriod timePeriod)
        Sets the new time period
        Parameters:
        timePeriod - The new time period

      • setLimit

        public void setLimit(int limit)
        Sets the new limit
        Parameters:
        limit - The new limit

      • hasStarted

        public boolean hasStarted()
        Checks whether this Paginator has sent a request yet. Calling reset() resets this.
        Returns:
        True if this Paginator has sent a request yet, false if else

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the listing. Call this method after you call a setter method such as setTimePeriod(TimePeriod)

      • invalidate

        protected void invalidate()
        Invalidates the current listing. This must be called in setter methods to notify getListing(boolean) that its parameters have changed.
